unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Numbering People
question_text: You want to find out how often you would end up with a group of $5$ men and $5$ women if you were picking a group of $10$ people out of a group of $350$ men and $400$ women.  Using a random number table you would choose $10$ people at a time over and over to make this estimate using simulation.  How would the people be numbered?

choices.text: Let 000 000 - 349 349 be men and 350 350 - 749 749 be women.
